title: Team situation awareness and conflict: A study of human–machine teaming
author: Nathan J McNeese, Mustafa Demir, Nancy J Cooke, Manrong She
abstract: OBJECTIVE: >This article focuses on two fundamental human–human teamwork behaviors and seeks to understand them better in human–machine teams. Specifically, team situation awareness (TSA) and team conflict are examined in human–machine teams. There is a significant need to identify how TSA and team conflict occur during human–machine teaming, in addition to how they impact each other. In this work, we present an experiment aimed at understanding TSA and team conflict in the context of human–machine teaming in a remotely piloted aircraft system (RPAS).
